titleStmt.title: Flora Ohler v. George and Charles S. Shafer. Order Granting Petition.

bibl.title: Flora Ohler v. George and Charles S. Shafer.
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

keywords.term: Third Judicial District Court of Nebraska

div1.p: Now on this 3rd day of May, 1898, came Flora Ohler, by her attorney W.R. Starr and McClure & Anderson, presentewd her petition, duly verified, praying for a writ of habeas corpus, and satisfied me by aufficient evidence, that said Naomi A. Gielday is unlawfully deprived of her liberty, and it being made to appear that said Naomi A. Giedlay is unlawfully detained, it is therefore ordered that a writ of habeas corpus be allowed and issued in favor of said Flora Ohler for the person of Naomi A. Gielday returnable fortwith, and be directed to J.R. Neal, sheriff of Red Willow County, Nebraska.
ENDORSED: 23-85--- In re Application of Flora Ohler for a Writ of Habeas Corpus & Order granting Writ--- Clerk's Office District Court,---Filed May 3-1898--- Sam E Low Clerk District Court.
